word: \93Tightly clasped in her arms was a pretty little parasol. Occasionally she would loosen her hold on it for a moment as if about to let it fall, then her grasp would tighten upon it again; all the time she seemed to be regarding it with a peculiar fascination. At last she cried out: \91Dear Jesus, I want to love thee and go to heaven! Take away my sins! I give myself to thee, parasol and all.\92 She threw herself into her mother's arms weeping and exclaiming: \91Ma, I am so happy, for Jesus loves me, and I love him better than my parasol or anything else!
